content:
I cannot predict the future, but i can suggest that it is likely that many of the changes and adaptations made by cherokee communities to preserve their culture during the pandemic will continue well beyond the end of the pandemic. 

for instance, the online language classes, virtual cultural events, social media platforms, and digital storytelling that cherokee communities have adopted have proven effective in preserving their culture and reaching a broader audience. these digital practices have also created new opportunities for cultural exchange that did not exist before, allowing cherokee traditions and cultural practices to be shared with people worldwide.

furthermore, the pandemic has highlighted the importance of preserving and celebrating cultural heritage, not just for the cherokee nation but for all indigenous communities globally. the pandemic has brought attention to the unique challenges faced by marginalized communities and highlighted the urgency of preserving cultural traditions that could otherwise be lost.

in summary, while it is not possible to predict the future, it is reasonable to assume that the innovations that cherokee communities have introduced to preserve their culture during the pandemic may continue beyond the end of the pandemic.
